sections.title: Protect teeth from sport, grinding, or post-orthodontic movement
sections.body: Mouthguards and retainers have different jobs, but both rely on precise fit to work properly. A custom mouthguard protects teeth and soft tissues during sport by distributing impact forces, while a retainer helps maintain tooth position after orthodontic treatment. We assess your bite, lifestyle needs and any existing dental work, then use impressions or digital scans to create an appliance thatâ€™s secure, comfortable and easy to clean. Regular review matters because appliances can wear, distort or stop fitting well as teeth change. The aim is predictable protection and long-term stability, not a quick off-the-shelf compromise.
bullets: Fitted from precise impressions or digital scans
Options for night grinding, sports contact, and orthodontic retention
Clear guidance on how long to wear and when to review

sections.title: Patients who need protection or retention
items: Clenching or grinding that marks or shortens teeth
Contact sports or training where impacts are likely
People with TMJ discomfort who benefit from bite support
Anyone wanting clear instructions on care and review intervals

sections.title: Plan, fit, and review the guard or retainer
sections.body: We check your bite, wear patterns, and sports or retention needs before recommending a device. Impressions or scans guide fabrication, with fit checks to confirm comfort and stability. Review intervals are agreed so you know when to replace or adjust.
bullets: Medical and dental history reviewed before fabrication
Bite assessment to confirm thickness, coverage, and durability needs
Fit checks to ensure speech, breathing, and comfort remain easy
Written advice on cleaning, storage, and when to seek a remake
Scheduled reviews to monitor wear or orthodontic stability

faqs.question: How long do guards or retainers last?
faqs.answer: Longevity depends on wear and bite forces. We will show you how to spot thinning or cracks and advise when to replace or adjust.

faqs.question: Can I choose between lab-made and 3D printed?
faqs.answer: Yes. We recommend the material based on durability, comfort, and how your bite loads the device, then confirm your preference.

faqs.question: How do I clean and store them?
faqs.answer: Use lukewarm water, non-abrasive cleaning aids, and a ventilated case. Avoid hot water or harsh chemicals that distort the fit.

faqs.question: What if my retainer feels tight?
faqs.answer: Mild tightness after a break can be normal. If pressure is painful or teeth have shifted, contact us for a review before continuing.
